sections.Trivia:
- One of the brandy bottles is a Napoleon Royal and there is a bottle of Glenfiddich scotch whisky.
- The police car from Mystery of the Burning Tent reappears.
- A few of the unsolved cases that had plots written by Misao Hamanaka include:
- Yoshio Chan's Kidnapping and Hostage Case (義雄ちゃん誘拐人質事件 ,Yoshio-chan yūkai hitojichi jiken?);
- Takarazuka's Treasure Murder Case (宝塚お宝アイテム殺人事件 ,Takaradzuka otakara aitemu satsujin jiken?);
- Case of the Lop-Eared Rabbit's Walk (垂れ耳うさぎお散歩事件 ,Tare mimi usagi o sanpo jiken?);
- Attempted Rock n' Roller Cosplay Case (ロックンローラーコスプレ未遂事件 ,Rokkunrōrākosupure misui jiken?).
- Among these cases, "Yoshio Chan's Kidnapping and Hostage Case" is a tribute to Yoshio Urasawa, the teacher of screenplay writer Akatsuki Yamatoya.
- Tatsumi Wada's age is stated to be 39 in his suspects' box, but when Takagi mentions his whereabouts, he is said to be 48.
- The complete criminal plan that Wada purchased from Hamanaka is No. 980, which is exactly the same number as this episode.
- Wada's car is a white Suzuki Swift. The license plate is 新宿 530, み 9・05 (Shinjuku 530, 9・05).
